text: [music playing]

HOLLY FIRFER: As
the saying goes,

everything's bigger
in Texas, which

is why it's no surprise that
business travelers heading

to Dallas and
looking to see more

of the city on some down time
might find themselves here.

JUSTIN RENVILLE: The views,
the windows, the vistas,

the roof, just the overall
aura of the facility
is just immaculate.
It's beautiful.
It is big.

But, quite frankly, it's got
a very special feel to it.

A lot of people will spend
their time down on the field,
stand on the star.

HOLLY FIRFER: With a
capacity of 100,000 people,

AT&T Stadium, home to
the Dallas Cowboys,

is open to the public
almost every day of the year

and is a great place to slip
away but still get some work
done.

JUSTIN RENVILLE:
Our partners AT&T

means we have a spectacular
Wi-Fi connections.

It's free to visitors
here in the facility.

And if you're a
business traveler,

it is a-- just a
special special way

to come down, spend a little
bit of time during a layover.

Maybe you finish a meeting
early and you want to go
see something unique in Dallas.

We're 20 minutes away
from the airport.
We're centrally located.

We've got tons of space,
nooks, and crannies
for you to hang out in.

HOLLY FIRFER: Hang
out on the field,

or take a guided tour through
the players' locker room.

-These lockers are made
from an imported wood
from Africa called sapele wood.

HOLLY FIRFER: Take the
stage in the Press Room

and see where the
world-famous Dallas
Cowboys Cheerleaders hang out.

-We have 37 girls on the
cheerleading squad this year.

HOLLY FIRFER:
There's even a place

to grab a bite by
yourself, with colleagues,
or have a business meeting.

-The Stadium Club's
open daily from 11 AM
to about 11:00 PM or midnight.

We're open for lunch and
dinner, after-work cocktails.

HOLLY FIRFER: And if you
crave a little bit of culture,

you can take a tour of the
world-famous contemporary
artwork throughout the building.

PHIL WHITFIELD: The
artwork is in every corner.

Every concession stand,
every entrance way
there is world-class art.

If you come to town and you
want something a little bit

different, I'm going
to make it where
it's going to be your tour.

If it's one person--
they say, well, look.

I don't want to
go to the stadium
because it's just me by myself.
I'm going to take care of you.

HOLLY FIRFER: Need to start
your day with some serious java?

The Royal Blue Grocery is an
urban market with specialty
coffees and grab-and-go meals.

Located in the iconic
Highland Park neighborhood

with free Wi-Fi and
plenty of space,

it's a refuge from the
hustle and bustle of the city

and a little taste
of suburban Dallas.

And if you want just plain Texas
cool, check out this place.

JASON BOSO: The
Truck Yard is a bar

garden with full-bar cocktail
service out under the trees.

In the backyard, we allow
three local food trucks.

They're on a schedule, but
they do change every day.

HOLLY FIRFER: Open seven days
a week for lunch and dinner,

there's free Wi-Fi
and a big backyard.

JASON BOSO: There's
over 300 seats here.

And we've even got an
old truck with a bunch

of chairs in the back
of it if we run out.
So there's plenty of room.
We see people we--

sit down with their computer
and be here for six hours.

I hope they drink a
beer in the meantime.

But if they don't, they're
still welcome because there's
plenty of space.

You're going to remember it
when you come here, I promise.

HOLLY FIRFER: Holly
Firfer, CNN, Dallas.
